ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 7
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Jame Scholl  To:  Sent: Tuesday, May 11, 1999 10:16 PM Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] Digest
ygData.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: Jame Scholl <satyric@...>
To: <EQ_spell_research@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 11, 1999 10:16 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] Digest Number 7


<Nipped a bunch of good stuff>
> Another nifty possible use for languages: improving your faction with
> someone. Going up to a merchant of another race and addressing them
> fluently in their own tongue should be worth something, shouldn't it?
Not
> that it is yet, but it'd be a fun suggestion for the non-magic races to
get
> some small use out of languages.

This would be a useful thing for those who do not cast spells..after
all....what could be better that talking to a NPC in his naitive tounge?

> Last thought: I wonder if it's possible to teach languages over a Guild
> channel?

Tried this..didn't work...you have to be in a group and use the group tell
AND your skill has to be better than the person that you are speaking to for
them to get any language skills out of it.

Auraelle
15th Wizard
Colletor of Lore items
E'ci
